channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17178] Add region balance throttling
item.description:
Our online cluster serves dozens of tables and different tables serve for different services. If the balancer moves too many regions in the same time,
it will decrease the availability for some table or some services. So we add region balance throttling on our online serve cluster.
We introduce a new config hbase.balancer.max.balancing.regions, which means the max number of regions in transition when balancing.
If we config this to 1 and a table have 100 regions, then the table will have 99 regions available at any time. It helps a lot for our use case and it has been running a long time
our production cluster.

But for some use case, we need the balancer run faster. If a cluster has 100 regionservers, then it add 50 new regionservers for peak requests. Then it need balancer run as soon as
possible and let the cluster reach a balance state soon. Our idea is compute max number of regions in transition by the max balancing time and the average time of region in transition.
Then the balancer use the computed value to throttling.

Examples for understanding.
A cluster has 100 regionservers, each regionserver has 200 regions and the average time of region in transition is 1 seconds, we config the max balancing time is 10 * 60 seconds.
Case 1. One regionserver crash, the cluster at most need balance 200 regions. Then 200 / (10 * 60s / 1s) < 1, it means the max number of regions in transition is 1 when balancing. Then the balancer can move region one by one and the cluster will have high availability when balancing.
Case 2. Add other 100 regionservers, the cluster at most need balance 10000 regions. Then 10000 / (10 * 60s / 1s) = 16.7, it means the max number of regions in transition is 17 when balancing. Then the cluster can reach a balance state within the max balancing time.

Any suggestions are welcomed.

Review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/54191/

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
+1 on the idea to throttle the region number moved in each iteration, we also had some similar discussion in HBASE-17110. Some minor questions:

1. Overall the idea is to do the throttling by setting a max balancing time, and region moving batch size is computed accordingly, right? It seems to me we already have a hbase.balancer.max.balancing configuration there (refer to HMaster#getBalancerCutoffTime) so I guess we could just reuse it?

2. Regarding this "average time of RIT", is it recorded and computed automatically? Or some manually set configurations?

Maybe a draft patch will make things easier for understanding (smile).

We have been used hbase.balancer.max.balancing.regions for a long time and set it to 1 for our online cluster. But recently we found that it was too small for some use case. So we plan to add a more automatically throttling strategy.

so I guess we could just reuse it?

Yeah, plan to use it.

Regarding this "average time of RIT", is it recorded and computed automatically?

I thought it can be recorded and computed by AssignmentManager. I will try to upload a patch today. Thanks.
Attach a v1 patch. Only add region in transition time in metrics of AssignmentManager. And add a new config for region in transition time.
The v1 patch didn't recorded the average time of RIT in AssignmentManager. Because it is duplicate with the metrics.

221	  public long getRitTime() {

getRitDuration would be better name.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
See HBASE-12890 for some related discussion / implementation ideas.

If I am not wrong, we are going to limit the concurrent RIT regions according to the number of plans and the time of this round. But average RIT duration in history may not show the current status of cluster. If RIT duration is longer than we expected, especially when we are moving too many regions, we may have to cut off in this round. So the probability of cutting off is higher than before, and may can not reach a balanced state when there are too many plans.

How about limiting the frequency of executing assignmentManager.balance(plan)? For example, if we are going to execute 100 plans and the hbase.balancer.max.balancing is 100 seconds, we just run plans one by one in every second. We may have more concurrent RIT regions if RIT duration is long but the probability of cutting off will not be higher than before. And of course the sleeping time can be shorter and if there is no RIT regions we can start a new plan immediately so we can end up all plans earlier if there is only few plans.
Thanks for your help. The goal of HBASE-12890 is to limit the total number regions in one balance round. And this issue's goal is to throttle the balance speed.
The goal of both, from what I can tell is to limit the unavailability of regions during balancing. I'm happy to see the issue picked up again, and hope an implementation makes it in this time.

Good idea. When RIT duration is longer than we expected, then there are more concurrent RIT regions. This will decrease the cluster availability... There is a trade-off between availability and how long to reach balance state.

Maybe we need a config to limit the max ratio of RIT regions? From 0.0 to 1.0, 0.0 means only one region. It is a direct way to protect the availability, 0.05 means at least 95% availability. And we will move as slow as possible to prevent RIT regions reach this bottom line.
Agreed. The max ratio is better than an absolute value by the config hbase.balancer.max.balancing.regions.

double maxRitPercent = getConfiguration().getDouble("hbase.master.balancer.maxRitPercent", 0.01);

Add the key and the default value in HConstants? And I think we can add this to hbase-default.xml with a description so that we can see it in hbase book.
And I am not sure if 0.01 is a good default value because currently we have no throttling which means maxRitPercent = 1.0. If we don't want to change anything by default, we should set it to 1.0?
Discussed with Guanghao Zhang offline. Throttling logic should be changed to a fix rate rather than fix interval.
Attach a v3 patch which addressed the review comments.
+1 on v3 patch. Let's see QA result.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.

Let's wait more reviews.
Guanghao Zhang Please prepare a patch for branch-1, thanks.

+        int maxRegionsInTransition = getMaxRegionsInTransition();

Move this line out of synchronized, like maximumBalanceTime


+    // Throttling by max number regions in transition

+    while (!interrupted

+        && maxRegionsInTransition > 0

+        && this.assignmentManager.getRegionStates().getRegionsInTransitionCount()

+        >= maxRegionsInTransition) {

+      try {

+        // sleep if the number of regions in transition exceeds the limit

+        Thread.sleep(100);

+      } catch (InterruptedException ie) {

+        interrupted = true;

+      }

+    }

Two questions on this part inside balanceThrottling:
1. Shall the balancing be affected by other RIT? Assuming RS crash happened in middle of balancing, shall we wait?
2. If some fatal error happens and cause some regions in transition for a long time, the code flow of balancer might block here and not controlled by the cutoffTime?

And maybe upload the patch into RB will make the review/comment easier (smile), thanks.

Review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/54191/

Move this line out of synchronized

Fixed in v4 patch.

Shall the balancing be affected by other RIT? Assuming RS crash happened in middle of balancing, shall we wait?

Yes, balancing will be affected by other RIT. This is for availability. If RS crash happend in middle of balancing, there will be more regions in transition. Then the balancer can't finish all region plans. The cluster need a next round balance to reach a balance state.

the code flow of balancer might block here and not controlled by the cutoffTime?

Fixed in v4 patch. It need break the sleep when exceeds cutoff time.
Overall LGTM, +1. Left some comment in RB, please check it there. Thanks.

+1 overall

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Add region balance throttling. Master execute every region balance plan per balance interval, which is equals to divide max balancing time by the size of region balance plan. And Introduce a new config hbase.master.balancer.maxRitPercent to protect availability. If config this to 0.01, then the max percent of regions in transition is 1% when balancing. Then the cluster's availability is at least 99% when balancing.
